title: Why is K-POP so much better than J-POP, when the Japanese are also good-looking and artistic? - Quora

response.answer_text: I agree with Samantha ( サマンタ) Keyes in her analysis. But here’s my take on it: The best songs of J-pop are on par with K-pop, but they are hidden within plain sight for reasons below. The perception of laypeople regarding J-pop is more or less just female idols, anime songs and nothing else. But this is a stereotype that few people realize that it’s untrue. The problems with the execution of Cool Japan which promotes these kind of music overseas exacerbates this problem. For a long time, J-pop suffers from accessibility issues. The problem still persists today, but it’s no longer as severe as certain Quorans like to claim. But thanks to the issue happening so long, the inertia leads to people not bothering with it other than knowing the aforementioned stereotype. There’s also the fact that K-pop idols have to train for years prior to debuting, in contrast of J-pop idols who are pretty much thrown into the stage with little to no training. As a result, J-pop idols get a bad first impression and pretty much dead on arrival when it comes to attracting overseas fans, which somewhat spills over to other J-pop artists regardless of quality. Instead of pondering the answers of this question, you should discover J-pop on your own pace over your favorite music streaming websites or YouTube and see which kind of J-pop appeals to you.

K-Pop is not so much better than J-Pop, it’s actually all about perspective. The main appeal of kpop, is the fact that the idols are perfect and can do no wrong. They don’t need to improve, because they are showcased as perfect. In this doing, however, it becomes quite risky because any scandal can terminate them completely. The main appeal of jpop, is improvement. It’s exploring your artistry. Jpop can’t showcase as much as kpop, because they take more time to do quality stuff. Kpop doesn’t need this latter appeal, because everything is pre-done for them. The amount of idols who really want to explore their musicality within the industry is limited. Japan is very much more diverse than Kpop when it comes to music, so the fandom is very divided. This creates the illusion it is difficult to find good music, when it’s right in front of you. A lot of people can’t see the modern jpop, because they are caught up in the “they’re so cute” stigma. A lot of the mainstream kpop is shoved in your face, and they all play it safe to get a major hit, therefore hindering the production of great artistry. A lot of people can’t see the best kpop, because there’s a stigma that it’s all the same. To end this, here are a few kpop and jpop recs, alternating from one to the other. Note: I’m not comparing, I thought it would be cool to alternate to give you a fresh start every time. Note number 2: I do realize I can’t put everything here, so yes, some of it is mainstream. And yes, it’s good mainstream for me. I won’t be putting anything else than pop tho, ask me for more if you want any.
